We’re excited to unveil this year’s theme: "For Our Nation, For Us All!"

The phrase "for our nation, for us all" encapsulates the spirit of service, unity, and dedication to both country and community that defines the Marine Corps Marathon. Known as "The People's Marathon," the race honors the U.S. Marine Corps’ values of honor, courage, and commitment, bringing together active-duty service members, veterans, and civilians in a shared pursuit of physical and mental endurance. This motto reinforces the idea that each participant runs not only for personal achievement but also as a tribute to the sacrifices made by our armed forces service members and in celebration of the strength and unity of the nation. It’s a reminder that the race, much like the service of the Marine Corps, is ultimately dedicated to the collective good, which often requires persevering in a common purpose defined by shared ideals and an indomitable spirit—serving and inspiring all.

Did you know we have a DEXA Scan available at Paige Field House? And that it’s FREE for base patrons to utilize? 🤯 

This service can cost hundreds of dollars at outside medical or training centers, so it’s definitely one to take advantage of!  Low level X-rays measure the density & mineral content of your bones and translate that into graphs and imagery that can be read by professionals like our MCCS dietician, Selina! 😉🩻

Come on in or email penhumanperformance@usmc-mccs.org to get started! For even MORE info, check out our upcoming Nutrition 101 class on Jan 15 at 11am. 🥕

Team USA Bobsledder💪 , 250th Marine Corps Ambassador 🦅, and Marine Captain Riley Tejcek wishes the Corps a happy 250th! 🎊   

🔗Learn more about the 250th Birthday Celebration, nearby events and contests at https://lnkd.in/emBkKMXm

#USMC #Marines250 #marines #usabobsledding #marinecorpsbirthday #MCX  #ItMattersWhereYouWork

We asked Captain Riley Tejcek, United States Marine Corps 🦅 🌎 ⚓  & Member of the Team USA Bobsled Team 

What does the Marine Corps’ 250th Birthday mean to you?

"Pure excellence. 250 years is a massive milestone as the Marine Corps has shown resiliency in every clime and place as we have continued to keep our country safe in every battle we have engaged in. Over the past 250 years we have seen so much growth and adaptation. I am thankful for the Marines who paved the road 250 years ago and am honored to be apart of the BEST warfighting organization as I get to see it to 250 years."

Read more of her story and join the 250th Celebration 🎊 🦅 at http://ms.spr.ly/6043o4uhz

#marines #usabobsledding #marinecorpsbirthday #MCX #MarineCorps250 #ItMattersWhereYouWork

🌟 New Year, New Opportunities with Marine For Life Network! 🌟
We’re excited to share the Winter Edition of the Warriors Connected Newsletter—your essential resource for staying informed and engaged with our growing community of Marines, Veterans, and military families. 💪

As we move forward into 2025, we remain dedicated to supporting you through valuable networking opportunities and connecting you to the resources you need. By fostering strong relationships, we’re building a network that empowers your successful transition to civilian life.

👇 Stay connected and take action today:
☑️ Read the newsletter for essential resources and updates.
☑️ Join our online community to connect with fellow Marines and Veterans.
☑️ Reach out for support or guidance on your transition journey.

👇 Need support? Connect with your local Marine For Life representative today!

Visit our website to connect with your local representative and receive personalized guidance for a successful transition. Whether you’re looking for career resources, networking opportunities, or military-friendly services, we’re here to support you every step of the way.

Michael Ellifritz, a Laborer at Onslow Beach, is presented with the MCCS Unsung Hero Award by Sarah Wiltgen, Assistant Chief of Staff, MCCS MCIEAST.

Michael Ellifritz's dedication and contribution to Onslow Beach has made him a friendly face for patrons, beachgoers, and staff alike. He proactively supports the Housekeeping and Maintenance teams in many ways, from preparing rental units and meeting daily check-in goals to carrying out routine tasks like trimming, painting, assembling furniture, or building small structures and benches. As a Laborer, he is a jack of all trades, and his work has a direct and lasting impact on our guests. Through open communication and a willingness to lend a hand, Michael builds strong relationships with his team while ensuring 100% satisfaction of internal clients and patrons. His superb time management and task handling are essential to the success of Onslow Beach. Achieving goals at Onslow Beach is made possible thanks to Mr. Ellifritz, and his support on the island is noticed and most appreciated.

✨ Static Display Sunday Spotlight: The F-35B Lightning II ✈️

This Sunday, we’re diving into the jaw-dropping specs of one of the most advanced fighter jets in the world—the F-35B Lightning II! 🚀

👉 Role: Multi-role stealth fighter
👉 Max Speed: Mach 1.6 (~1,200 mph)
👉 Thrust: 38,000 lbs Max
👉 Range: 900 nautical miles
👉 Wingspan: 35 ft
👉 Unique Feature: Short Takeoff/Vertical Landing (STOVL) capability—yes, it hovers! 🔥

Witness the might and innovation of Marine Corps aviation! Whether you're an aviation enthusiast or just love cutting-edge technology, the F-35B is a marvel to see up close.

Come see it at the 2025 MCAS Beaufort Airshow, where we celebrate 250 years of Marine Corps excellence. 🇺🇸

📅 Date: April 12-13, 2025
📍 Location: MCAS Beaufort, South Carolina
🎟️ Get your tickets today at http://ms.spr.ly/6180oFsaw!

#F35B #aviation #MCASBeaufortAirshow #USMC250

✨ This past Saturday, the library transformed into the wizarding world for a magical Harry Potter event! 🪄 

Witches, wizards, and muggles of all ages joined in the fun with potion-making, spell-casting, and trivia to test their Hogwarts knowledge. The library came alive as iconic locations like Ollivanders, the Magical Menagerie, and wizarding newsstands set the scene. ✨ Static Display Sunday Spotlight: The F-35B Lightning II ✈️

This Sunday, we’re diving into the jaw-dropping specs of one of the most advanced fighter jets in the world—the F-35B Lightning II! 🚀

👉 Role: Multi-role stealth fighter
👉 Max Speed: Mach 1.6 (~1,200 mph)
👉 Thrust: 38,000 lbs Max
👉 Range: 900 nautical miles
👉 Wingspan: 35 ft
👉 Unique Feature: Short Takeoff/Vertical Landing (STOVL) capability—yes, it hovers! 🔥

Witness the might and innovation of Marine Corps aviation! Whether you're an aviation enthusiast or just love cutting-edge technology, the F-35B is a marvel to see up close.

Come see it at the 2025 MCAS Beaufort Airshow, where we celebrate 250 years of Marine Corps excellence. 🇺🇸

📅 Date: April 12-13, 2025
📍 Location: MCAS Beaufort, South Carolina
🎟️ Get your tickets today at beaufortairshow.com!

We’re excited to unveil this year’s theme: "For Our Nation, For Us All!"

The phrase "for our nation, for us all" encapsulates the spirit of service, unity, and dedication to both country and community that defines the Marine Corps Marathon. Known as "The People's Marathon," the race honors the U.S. Marine Corps’ values of honor, courage, and commitment, bringing together active-duty service members, veterans, and civilians in a shared pursuit of physical and mental endurance. This motto reinforces the idea that each participant runs not only for personal achievement but also as a tribute to the sacrifices made by our armed forces service members and in celebration of the strength and unity of the nation. It’s a reminder that the race, much like the service of the Marine Corps, is ultimately dedicated to the collective good, which often requires persevering in a common purpose defined by shared ideals and an indomitable spirit—serving and inspiring all!

We asked Captain Riley Tejcek, United States Marine Corps 🦅 🌎 ⚓ & member of the U.S Women’s Olympic Bobsled team. 

What does the Marine Corps’ 250th Birthday mean to you?

"Pure excellence. 250 years is a massive milestone as the Marine Corps has shown resiliency in every clime and place as we have continued to keep our country safe in every battle we have engaged in. Over the past 250 years we have seen so much growth and adaptation. I am thankful for the Marines who paved the road 250 years ago and am honored to be apart of the BEST warfighting organization as I get to see it to 250 years."

Read more of her story and join the 250th Celebration 🎊 🦅 at https://www.mymcx.com/usmc-250th-anniversary

#marines #usabobsledding #marinecorpsbirthday #MCX #MarineCorps250 #ItMattersWhereYouWork

🛩️ Static Display Sunday Spotlight: The Cessna L-19/O-1 Bird Dog 🐾

This week, we’re taking it back to the roots of reconnaissance with the Cessna L-19/O-1 Bird Dog—a light observation and liaison aircraft that played a crucial role in military history!

👉 Role: Observation, reconnaissance, and artillery spotting
👉 Top speed: 130 mph
👉 Wingspan: 36 ft
👉 Range: 530 miles
👉 Power plant: Horizontally-opposed Continental O470 engine with 185 horsepower
👉 In-service dates: 1950 to mid-1980s

The Bird Dog may not be the fastest in the sky, but its vital role in shaping military aviation tactics can’t be overstated. Stop by to see this piece of history up close at the 2025 MCAS Beaufort Airshow!

📅 Date: April 12-13, 2025
📍 MCAS Beaufort, South Carolina
🎟️ Get your tickets at http://ms.spr.ly/6185oFLvc!

It’s the perfect opportunity to witness a storied piece of aviation history and honor the legacy of 250 years of Marine Corps excellence! 🇺🇸

#BirdDog #CessnaL19 #BeaufortAirshow #StaticDisplaySunday #USMC250

We are excited to offer a variety of accommodations, including beach cottages, cabanas, Klipper Villas, and the Fairway Inn. Please take a moment to familiarize yourself with our booking policies to ensure a smooth and enjoyable stay. We are excited to have you stay with us & experience true Aloha aboard Marine Corps Base Hawaii! 

Booking Policies:
-Cabanas, Fairway Inn, and Klipper Villas: Reservations can be made up to 12 months in advance by authorized patrons. The maximum stay is 14 nights. 
-Reservations must be made under the sponsor's name, who must be present at check-in with valid ID.
-To hold your reservation, a first night's deposit is required at the time of booking. We also have a 48-hour cancellation/modification policy. If this is not met the deposit will not be refunded.

Beach Cottages:
  - Active Duty: 12 months in advance
  - Retirees/Reservist : 8 months in advance
  - Veterans/DOD Employees: 6 months in advance
  - 7 night max stay
  - One Cottage per service member every 90-day period. 
  -No check ins or outs on weekends or federal holidays. 

Seabee Cottage $188 a night 
-Seabee Priority 
-M-F 0900-1700
Please call (808) 472-1631 to make reservations 

 
Distinguished Guest Cottage $202 a night 
   -Rank Restricted
-  E8/E9 or O6 & above 
- M-F 0800-1700
Please call (808) 496-8853/7704 

- Check-In: 15:00
- Check-Out:11:00

Access Information:
-Access to cabanas and cottages requires crossing an active runway. A valid ID is mandatory at the crossing point. Please be aware that no pedestrians are allowed; a bike, motorcycle, or vehicle is required.

 Pet Policies:
- Pets are prohibited in the Fairway Inn, cabanas, and cottages.
- In our pet-friendly units at Klipper Villas, a maximum of 2 pets(up to 76 lbs each) are allowed, with health certificates required.

Rates:
- Beach Cottages: $183/night (2 bedrooms with queen beds, full bath, kitchen, living room, TV, AC, lanai, grill, oceanfront)
- Cabanas:$88/night (1 king bed or 2 queens, mini fridge, coffee maker, microwave, sink, TV, AC, beachfront, community showers/restrooms)
*Ohana Room:$158/night (5 queens, community showers/restrooms, beachfront)

Jacksonville-Onslow Sports Commission is proud to present the "Sledgehammer Beach Run" in memory of Dr. E. B. Sledge. Take in the views and explore North Topsail Beach while running on the beach in either the Half Marathon, 10k or 5k. Sledge was a lifelong Marine who spent the remainder of his post-war years coming to terms with what he and his fellow combatants experienced during World War II. Part of the proceeds go to Semper Fi & America's Fund. Register now at ww.sledgehammerbeachrun.com.

🌟 Static Display Sunday Spotlight: Nakajima B5N "Kate" Replica 🇯🇵

Step back in time and explore the legendary Nakajima B5N “Kate”, a Japanese torpedo bomber that played a significant role in World War II. This stunning replica, that was built in 1969 for the movie Tora! Tora! Tora!, brings history to life, giving you a rare chance to see this iconic aircraft up close!

👉 Role: Torpedo and level bomber
👉 Wingspan: 15.5 m
👉 Length: 10.3 m
👉 Cruise speed: 161 mph

The “Kate” earned its place in aviation history during pivotal moments like the attack on Pearl Harbor and the Battle of Midway. This replica honors its place in history while serving as a powerful reminder of the bravery and sacrifices made during wartime.

🛩️ Don’t miss your chance to see this incredible piece of history at the 2025 Beaufort Airshow, as we commemorate 250 years of honor, courage, and commitment. 

Get your tickets at beaufortairshow.com!

New Blog Post!

New Year, New Running Goals? Consider a different approach this time around. Instead of focusing on personal bests and data points, embrace the experience and consistency of running. 

This year, let running be a journey of presence, resilience, and connection. It's not just about the numbers—it's about the memories, the unexpected moments, and the growth that happen along the way.

Ready to make this the year of sustainable progress and lasting joy? Head over to our website to read more from Race Director, Alex Hetherington and discover how focusing on the process can unlock your true potential.

🛩️ Static Display Sunday Spotlight: The Cessna L-19/O-1 Bird Dog 🐾

This week, we’re taking it back to the roots of reconnaissance with the Cessna L-19/O-1 Bird Dog—a light observation and liaison aircraft that played a crucial role in military history!

👉 Role: Observation, reconnaissance, and artillery spotting
👉 Top speed: 130 mph
👉 Wingspan: 36 ft
👉 Range: 530 miles
👉 Power plant: Horizontally-opposed Continental O470 engine with 185 horsepower
👉 In-service dates: 1950 to mid-1980s

The Bird Dog may not be the fastest in the sky, but its vital role in shaping military aviation tactics can’t be overstated. Stop by to see this piece of history up close at the 2025 MCAS Beaufort Airshow!

📅 Date: April 12-13, 2024
📍 MCAS Beaufort, South Carolina
🎟️ Get your tickets at beaufortairshow.com!

It’s the perfect opportunity to witness a storied piece of aviation history and honor the legacy of 250 years of Marine Corps excellence! 🇺🇸

#BirdDog #CessnaL19 #BeaufortAirshow #StaticDisplaySunday #USMC250 #AviationHistory

In today’s digital age, it’s easy to get lost in the whirlwind of emails, notifications, and constant updates. But what if there was a way to step back, clear your mind, and boost your creativity—all while improving your health? 

Running is the perfect antidote to the information overload of our IT-driven world. It’s not just about fitness—it’s about regaining control over your focus and mental clarity.

Want to learn how running can restore your productivity, health, and well-being? Read the full post on our website! ⬇️

🌟 Static Display Sunday Spotlight: Nakajima B5N "Kate" Replica 🇯🇵

Step back in time and explore the legendary Nakajima B5N “Kate”, a Japanese torpedo bomber that played a significant role in World War II. This stunning replica, that was built in 1969 for the movie Tora! Tora! Tora!, brings history to life, giving you a rare chance to see this iconic aircraft up close!

👉 Role: Torpedo and level bomber
👉 Wingspan: 15.5 m
👉 Length: 10.3 m
👉 Cruise speed: 161 mph

The “Kate” earned its place in aviation history during pivotal moments like the attack on Pearl Harbor and the Battle of Midway. This replica honors its place in history while serving as a powerful reminder of the bravery and sacrifices made during wartime.

🛩️ Don’t miss your chance to see this incredible piece of history at the 2025 Beaufort Airshow, as we commemorate 250 years of honor, courage, and commitment. 

Get your tickets at beaufortairshow.com!

MCB Camp Pendleton, CA, is looking to fill a DEPLOYMENT READINESS COORDINATOR NF4, 2nd BN 1st MAR position!

Serves as the point of contact to the unit Commander at the Colonel Level. Oversees the Commander’s Unit, Personal Family Readiness Program (UPFRP) for the designated units. 🚨 RED FLAG WARNING – Southern California 🚨
⚠️ When: Wednesday to Thursday
⚠️ Where: Greater Los Angeles County, San Gabriel and San Fernando Valleys, San Diego & Riverside Mountains, Eastern San Diego Valleys, Inland Orange County, Santa Ana Mountains, Inland Empire and San Bernardino Foothills
🔥 Conditions: Strong Santa Ana winds, low humidity, and critically dry fuels.
⚠️ High Risk: Extreme fire danger—any spark could lead to fast, uncontrollable wildfire spread.
Stay vigilant, avoid activities that could spark fires, and have an evacuation plan ready. 🌬️🔥
#RedFlagWarning #FireWeather #SantaAnaWinds

Ready for an Adventure? 🪖🔦
Explore Okinawa's Hidden Wartime Tunnels! 

Join us on a unique and unforgettable journey through time as we uncover the secrets of Okinawa's WWII past. 

You would never have guessed that these caves and tunnels existed based on the location. 
Our tour guide, with over 20 years of experience, will lead you through this hidden world, sharing fascinating stories and insights. 🥾✨

Date: Saturday,  February 8th 
Time: 9:00 - 17:00
Adult: $45, Child (8-11): $38.

☝️Important Notes: 
Participants must be at least 8 years old to join the tour.

Bring dollars for lunch. Wear sturdy shoes, old clothes, and a hat.
Bring a flashlight and gloves. 🔦🧤

We asked Captain Riley E. Tejcek, United States Marine Corps 🦅 🌎 ⚓  & Member of the Team USA Bobsled Team.

What does the Marine Corps’ 250th Birthday mean to you?

"Pure excellence. 250 years is a massive milestone as the Marine Corps has shown resiliency in every clime and place as we have continued to keep our country safe in every battle we have engaged in. Over the past 250 years we have seen so much growth and adaptation. I am thankful for the Marines who paved the road 250 years ago and am honored to be apart of the BEST warfighting organization as I get to see it to 250 years. "

Read more of her story and join the 250th Celebration 🎊 🦅 at http://ms.spr.ly/6186o4uCY

#marines #usabobsledding #marinecorpsbirthday #MCX  #ItMattersWhereYouWork #marinecorps250

☀️ Sunday Skies: Flashing Back to Air Show Magic! ✈️

Let’s take off into the memories of the 2022 Kaneohe Bay Air Show, where the sky was the limit and the thrills were nonstop! From wingman-worthy stunts to jet-fueled excitement, it was a day that truly soared above the rest.

Let’s glide into the week with our sights set on the skies ahead!

Resource Spotlight 🔦  VA Vet Centers
U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Vet Centers provide a wide range of support services designed to help Veterans and their families navigate life's challenges after service. Whether you're seeking counseling, community outreach, or assistance with claims, Vet Centers are there for you. 

Key Services include:
🚐 Confidential Counseling: For combat veterans, family members, and survivors.
🚐 Readjustment Assistance: Transitioning from military to civilian life.
🚐 Employment Resources: Help with finding meaningful careers.
🚐 Benefits and Claims Support: Guidance through the VA claims process.

With over 300 locations across the country, these centers are a great and accessible resource for Veterans. If you or someone you know could benefit, don't hesitate to reach out to your local VA Vet Center. 

We want to hear from YOU! What military-friendly resource has made a difference in your life? Share your recommendations with us in the comments below, and help fellow Veterans and service members discover new ways to thrive.

#M4LNetwork #WarriorsConnected #VAVetCenters #Veterans #Resources

Come and Join this 4-week training session with Coach Michael Harvey (USATF Level III) to increase your Speed, Acceleration and Agility!!

Increase your speed, acceleration while improving your running mechanics and sprint efficiency.

This training program is open to authorized active-duty military personnel, dependents, retirees, and DOD civilians of all ages!

Sessions will take place on Tuesday & Thursday evenings from 7:00pm-8:15 pm at the SgtMaj Porter field Track.

Tuesdays will be Sprint mechanic improvements, Plyometric training, Speed & Acceleration focused drills.

Thursdays will include a Dynamic warm-up, Sprint & Biomechanics evaluations, and Laser-timed sprints to track progress throughout the 4-week training sessions.

Become your Best Self!!

Sign up: https://mccsraces.leagueapps.com/events/4476960-2025-semper-fit-spring-4-week-speed--acceleration-training-program

Due to forecasted winter weather anticipated in Beaufort County from Jan. 21-23, the depot commanding general has authorized the following changes to depot operations beginning today:
 
Jan. 21
 
Training aboard the base stopped at noon today for all recruits. Recruits are limited to training within their company barracks with their platoon leadership. The base mess halls have been closed,  and recruits will be given MREs. Drill instructors and company leadership will remain with recruits during the duration of the winter weather. 
 
Permanent personnel were released by their individual chains of command in preparation for the winter weather, with a release time of 12 p.m. for a 1 p.m. closure. 
 
Depot services and facilities began closing early. The base Child Development Center closed at 1 p.m. and MCCS contacted impacted families for picking up their children. The depot commissary and exchange will close today at 4 p.m.
 
Jan. 22
 
The base will be closed to the public. For the families of Alpha Company, all MCCS events aboard the base are cancelled and you will not have access to enter the base. 
 
For permanent personnel assigned to Parris Island, all facilities aboard the base (Exchange, Commissary, Gym, etc.) will be closed. 
 
All recruit training activities remain cancelled, and recruits will be limited to their barracks facilities. Recruits will conduct indoor training (drill, studying knowledge, etc.) with their platoon leadership throughout the day. 
 
Safety Advisory and Family Day/Graduation Updates

The safety of personnel remains the top priority. Please stay off the roads unless travel is absolutely necessary, as road conditions may worsen. Be sure to monitor updates regarding weather conditions, county school closures, and county road closures.
 
The motivational run is canceled. Further information regarding Family Day and Graduation Day activities will be provided as conditions are assessed.
Our passion is helping military families have a Positive Change of Schools (PCS). New duty station in your future? We can help! Call 910-449-9915 or 910-449-9749 today!
Samara Sandoval Base leadership is currently reevaluating conditions. Stand by for updated guidance on tomorrow's operations.

Ready for an Adventure? 🪖🔦
Explore Okinawa's Hidden Wartime Tunnels! 

Join us on a unique and unforgettable journey through time as we uncover the secrets of Okinawa's WWII past.

Our tour guide, with over 20 years of experience, will lead you through this hidden world, sharing fascinating stories and insights. 🥾✨

Adult: $45, Child (8-11): $38.

The Marine and Family Programs Division is conducting a survey on Marines’ awareness of current lethal means safety programs, preferences for safety devices and locations, and considerations for LMS messaging specific to Marine Corps culture.

If you are interested and available to participate, follow the link to take the survey. https://cnaorg.gov1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_38L0FHrDBaBpuES

The survey will close on January 31, 2025. Participation should take no more than 15 minutes. No names, contact information, or any other personally identifiable information will be collected in the survey.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Due to forecasted winter weather anticipated in Beaufort County from Jan. 21-23, the depot commanding general has authorized the following changes to depot operations beginning today:
 
Jan. 21
 
Training aboard the base stopped at noon today for all recruits. Recruits are limited to training within their company barracks with their platoon leadership. The base mess halls have been closed,  and recruits will be given MREs. Drill instructors and company leadership will remain with recruits during the duration of the winter weather. 
 
Permanent personnel were released by their individual chains of command in preparation for the winter weather, with a release time of 12 p.m. for a 1 p.m. closure. 
 
Depot services and facilities began closing early. The base Child Development Center closed at 1 p.m. and MCCS contacted impacted families for picking up their children. The depot commissary and exchange will close today at 4 p.m.
 
Jan. 22
 
The base will be closed to the public. For the families of Alpha Company, all MCCS events aboard the base are cancelled and you will not have access to enter the base. 
 
For permanent personnel assigned to Parris Island, all facilities aboard the base (Exchange, Commissary, Gym, etc.) will be closed. 
 
All recruit training activities remain cancelled, and recruits will be limited to their barracks facilities. Recruits will conduct indoor training (drill, studying knowledge, etc.) with their platoon leadership throughout the day. 
 
Safety Advisory and Family Day/Graduation Updates

The safety of personnel remains the top priority. Please stay off the roads unless travel is absolutely necessary, as road conditions may worsen. Be sure to monitor updates regarding weather conditions, county school closures, and county road closures.
 
The motivational run is canceled. Further information regarding Family Day and Graduation Day activities will be provided as conditions are assessed.

The depot will reopen to the public tomorrow for Alpha Company’s graduation. 

For permanent personnel, the base with operate with essential personnel only. Individual chain of commands will identify the manpower needed to support tomorrow’s activities and will make contact with those Marines as appropriate. 

Due to the winter weather impacting Beaufort County, the following changes have been implemented for accessing the base tomorrow. 

Due to snow and ice accumulation, the Visitor’s Gate is inaccessible and will be closed tomorrow. The main gate will be used by everyone for entry to the base. Visitors coming for graduation will be able to access the depot beginning at 7 a.m. We ask families to please strictly follow this 7 a.m. timeline to alleviate any traffic issues at the main gate. Families arriving before 7 a.m will be barred access. 

The Douglas Visitor Center, Post Exchange, and All Weather Training Facility will be the only locations on the base open tomorrow. All other facilities to include the museum, eateries, commissary, etc., will remain closed. 

The Douglas Visitor Center will open at 7 a.m. to the public. 

The graduation ceremony will begin at 10 a.m. in the All Weather Training Facility. Marines and signage will direct all visitors to the appropriate location upon entry to the base. As a reminder, the Morning Colors Ceremony has been canceled. 

For Alpha Company families who had paid for the Family Day dinner, refunds have been issued. For individuals who have paid for items to include corsages, signs, etc., those items can be picked up at the location identified on your receipt, email, or postcard.

NO SCHOOL TODAY !!!  For KADENA DODEA Kadena Elementary School, DODEA Bechtel Elementary School and DODEA Ryukyu Middle School Families:
Message from DoDEA:
We learned at approximately 0400 that Kadena ES, Bechtel ES, and Ryukyu MS are experiencing sewer challenges. Our installation partners are working hard to solve the situation; however, we are uncertain of when they will be resolved. As such, we have made the decision to cancel school for students for today, Monday, 27 January 2025. 
Our installation partners have confirmed that school age care will be open throughout the day to support.
We recognize changes to school operations impact families and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. It is our intent to resume normal operations as soon as possible and we will continue to provide updates.
We appreciate your flexibility and understanding.
Pacific South DSO

Halfway Through the School Year? Let United Through Reading Help Your Family Stay Connected and Thriving!
As we reach the midpoint of the school year, it's a great time to refocus and recharge. United Through Reading is here to support military families in maintaining strong bonds and academic success. Here’s how United Through Reading can help your children thrive:
Routine and Stability: Establish a consistent reading routine that provides comfort and stability, especially during times of change.
Learning and Literacy: Enhance your child's reading skills and academic success with regular storytime sessions.
Emotional Connection: Strengthen the bond between deployed parents and their children by sharing stories and remaining present in their daily lives.
 
Incorporating United Through Reading into your family’s routine ensures your child feels supported, loved, and ready to tackle the second half of the school year. Visit UTR.org for literacy tips, reading recommendations, and a curated book list. Get started today and discover the difference that reading together can make.

MCCS Sponsor. No federal or DoD endorsement implied.

The start of a new year is the perfect time to reflect and set meaningful goals for yourself. If prioritizing your health is at the top of your resolution list, check out the tips and resources below to help you stay motivated and on track:

1️⃣ Join one of our FREE group fitness classes at an MCCS Fitness Center near you: https://www.okinawa.usmc-mccs.org/recreation-fitness/fitness/health-promotion/group-exercise.

2️⃣ Work with a personal trainer to help you stay accountable and achieve your fitness goals: https://www.okinawa.usmc-mccs.org/recreation-fitness/fitness/personal-training. 

3️⃣ Treat yourself to some well-deserved self-care with our massage services: https://www.okinawa.usmc-mccs.org/recreation-fitness/fitness/massage-services. 

4️⃣ Try healthy and delicious options at LifeJuice and other MCCS clubs/restaurants: https://www.okinawa.usmc-mccs.org/dining-entertainment/dining/cafes/life-juice-cafe.

MCAGCC 29 Palms, CA, is looking to fill a Fitness Center Manager NF3 position!

Majority of the incumbents' time will be spent supervising staff in the daily operations of the facility. Responsible for the overall operation and control of the area recreational programs, property and equipment. Supervises layout and cleanliness of the fitness center and surrounding areas such as outdoor strength & conditioning facilities, parking lots, tracks, and fields. 
Responsible for the purchase, upkeep, accurate inventory, and maintenance of equipment and property. May receive and register payment for services or sales using a cash register. Responsible for training, scheduling of work shifts, performance appraisals, and supervision of civilian and/or active-duty staff. 

To learn more about the position and minimum qualifications, please visit https://lnkd.in/ehr5X92. (Job ID: 71500 https://lnkd.in/ehVzvRsi)

That's what we want you to think when you notice online signs that a friend might be struggling - using dark humor, posting cryptic messages, or images of concerning behavior.

MCB Camp Pendleton, CA is looking to fill the SUBSTANCE ASSESSMENT COUNSELING CENTER SUPERVISOR NF4 position!

This position will serve as a CLINICAL SUPERVISOR SACC NF4. This is an Interdisciplinary Position in that various specialties in the social and behavioral sciences can provide the necessary background to successfully perform the aspects of the job. The exact series of the position will be determined by the background and area of qualification of the employee selected for the position. Independently oversees professional counseling staff and the day-to-day operations of an ongoing substance misuse focused non-medical counseling program designed to prevent and provide non-medical counseling and supportive services for alcohol and drug misuse related problems of active-duty military and their eligible family members, as space permits. Work is reviewed for overall program effectiveness.

To learn more about the position and minimum qualifications, please visit https://lnkd.in/ehr5X92 

Job ID: 71431 https://lnkd.in/ebrXVJZZ

Preparing for retirement or transitioning out of service? 

The Blended Retirement System (BRS) combines a traditional pension with a portable, 401(k)-style plan to help military service members secure their financial future—whether you're in it for the long haul or planning your next chapter. 

Understanding your retirement options is key, and the Marine for Life Network is here to support you with the resources and guidance you need.


#M4LNetwork #BlendedRetirementSystem #RetirementPlanning #TransitionSupport #WarriorConnected

Did you know we have a DEXA Scan available at Paige Field House? And that it’s FREE for base patrons to utilize? 🤯 This service can cost hundreds of dollars at outside medical or training centers, so it’s definitely one to take advantage of!  Low level X-rays measure the density & mineral content of your bones and translate that into graphs and imagery that can be read by professionals like our MCCS dietician, Selina! 😉🩻Come on in or email penhumanperformance@usmc-mccs.org to get started!

🌟 Looking for your next great read? 🌟 Whether you're in the mood for heartfelt romance, gripping suspense, or epic fantasy, we’ve got something for every book lover! Check out these fan favorites from 2024 (all available for checkout through the Camp Pendleton Libraries!) and find your next page-turner:

👰 The Wedding People by Alison Espach
"The year’s surprise sensation, Alison Espach’s improbably fun novel follows the adventures of a severely bummed out young woman who finds herself accidentally crashing a lavish wedding at a posh Rhode Island inn. Readers love Espach’s twisty tonal shifts—from high drama to screwball comedy of manners—and the ultimate moral of her story: Go with the flow; who knows what might happen?" - Goodreads

🎖 The Women by Kristin Hannah
"An insightful meditation on courage, character, and women gone to war, Kristin Hannah’s novel introduces idealistic Army nurse Frances “Frankie” McGrath as she volunteers in Vietnam, circa 1965. Incredibly, her life gets even more complicated when she returns to a dangerously divided America." - Goodreads

🌲 The God of the Woods by Liz Moore
"In 1975, troubled teenager Barbara Van Laar vanished from her bunk at the summer camp owned by her wealthy family. Making things so much worse: Her older brother disappeared much the same way, 16 years ago. Author Liz Moore expands this intriguing premise into an emotionally engaging mystery that blends elements of crime fiction, psychological suspense, and complex family drama." - Goodreads

😂 Funny Story by Emily Henry
"Romance queen Emily Henry takes home her fourth consecutive GCA with Funny Story, an instructive modern parable about a heartbroken librarian who attempts an extremely tricky maneuver: hooking up with her ex-fiancé’s new fiancée’s ex. (Very dangerous—don’t try this at home.) Hollywood trade reports suggest that Henry will be writing her own screenplay for the upcoming film adaptation." - Goodreads

🔥 House of Flame and Shadow by Sarah J. Maas
In this epic fantasy, a young woman with incredible powers must navigate a world of politics, betrayal, and war. As her loyalty is tested and enemies close in, she must face the shadow of her past and embrace the strength within. In the 3rd installment of her Crescent City series, Maas crafts an enthralling tale of magic, passion, and danger. 

⏳ The Ministry of Time by Kaliane Bradley
A captivating, mind-bending exploration of time travel and its consequences, where a secret ministry protects history from interference. The protagonist discovers the complexities of altering the past, and the personal cost of such power. Bradley’s narrative delivers suspense and thought-provoking questions about fate and free will.

🖤 You Like It Darker by Stephen King
"Maine’s resident gentleman maniac returns with a short story collection on the abiding terrors of the human condition—fate and mortality, tragedy and violence. Also: rattlesnakes. King is the king of the horror novel, of course, but he’s a master of short fiction, too, and many are calling this collection his finest yet." - Goodreads

🌊 Somewhere Beyond the Sea by T.J. Klune
"In the sequel to 2020’s much-admired The House in the Cerulean Sea, author T.J. Klune returns to the mysterious orphanage on Marsyas Island and its menagerie of magical children and creatures. Klune’s themes of unconditional love and found family have attracted a loyal readership." - Goodreads

🚨 INSTALLATION SECURITY ADVISORY 🚨 

Due to recent events in New Orleans and Las Vegas, the Commander of U.S. Northern Command (USNORTHCOM) has directed all installations to immediately implement heightened security measures at all entry gates to include 100% ID checks, random inspections and the suspension of the Trusted Traveler program until further notice. 

The Trusted Traveler Program was a procedure that allowed DoD-affiliated sponsors to vouch for vehicle occupants to gain entry onto an installation. All unvetted visitors must report to the installation Visitor Center to request access. 

For further details on MCRD Parris Island access procedures please visit: https://www.mcrdpi.marines.mil/Visitors/Base-Access/

Drivers should expect delays and random inspections at all entry gates as we enhance the security posture of our installation to ensure our ability to project combat power when and where required.

Halfway Through the School Year? Let United Through Reading Help Your Family Stay Connected and Thriving!
As we reach the midpoint of the school year, it's a great time to refocus and recharge. United Through Reading is here to support military families in maintaining strong bonds and academic success. Here’s how United Through Reading can help your children thrive:
Routine and Stability: Establish a consistent reading routine that provides comfort and stability, especially during times of change.
Learning and Literacy: Enhance your child's reading skills and academic success with regular storytime sessions.
Emotional Connection: Strengthen the bond between deployed parents and their children by sharing stories and remaining present in their daily lives.
 
Incorporating United Through Reading into your family’s routine ensures your child feels supported, loved, and ready to tackle the second half of the school year. Visit UTR.org for literacy tips, reading recommendations, and a curated book list. Get started today and discover the difference that reading together can make.

MCCS Sponsor. No federal or DoD endorsement implied.

Administrative Assistant 
DaVita - 111 Yopp Rd, Jacksonville, NC

Be the "face" of one of the outpatient or hospital facilities-and use your administrative skills to impact the lives of our patients and their families. In this support role you will ensure the timely and accurate completion of change requisitions, treatment logs, patient charts, invoices and purchase orders. You also will assist patients with transportation arrangements and physician appointments.

Seeking personable individual with excellent computer and clerical skills (Microsoft Office). You must type 60 WPM and have a high school diploma or GED. Medical secretary or secretarial certification is preferred-as is at least 1 year in a related administrative position in a medical setting.

Apply online at: https://careers.davita.com/job/R0388864/Administrative-Assistant

The Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation scholarship application for the 2025-26 academic year is now open! 
Deadline is 1 March 2025.
Last year the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation awarded $11.7 million to more than 2,800 students for post-secondary education to children of Marines, Navy Corpsmen, Chaplains, and Religious Program Specialists. The Nation's oldest and largest provider of need-based scholarships to military children pursuing a post-secondary education at any accredited school--whether that be a trade school, career training program, community college, or four-year university. To apply, visit www.mcsf.org/apply.

⚠️ When: Wednesday to Thursday

🚤🌊 Fun Sailing Facts You Didn’t Know! 🌊🚤

1️⃣ The Fastest Sail Around the World: The fastest time to sail around the world is under 40 days! IDEC Sport completed the trip in just 40 days, 23 hours, and 30 minutes! ⏱️🌍

2️⃣ Sailing Vocabulary Comes from History: The word "knot" to measure speed comes from sailors using a log line with knots tied at regular intervals to track their speed on the water! 🪢💨

3️⃣ The Oldest Sailing Ship: The Khufu ship, dating back to 2500 BCE, is the oldest known sailing vessel. It was found near the Great Pyramid of Giza! ⛵🏺

4️⃣ The Tallest Mast Ever: The tallest sailing yacht mast ever built reaches a jaw-dropping 72 meters (236 feet) on Mirabella V! That’s higher than most skyscrapers! 🏙️⛵

Which one surprised you the most? 🌊 Let us know your favorite sailing fact in the comments! #Sailing #FunFacts #OceanAdventure

‼️ Base Access Advisory Update ‼️

Heightened security measures will continue at all entry gates, including 100% ID checks and random inspections, however, the command is taking steps to mitigate the impacts of these protocols on our service members and their families. 

For this weekend, during hours when the Camp Pendleton Visitor Center is closed, PMO may grant escort status to individuals who meet the requirements for DBIDS access. Please note that individuals requesting this access over the weekend will need to bring at least ONE of the following documents:

- Valid (unexpired) drivers license 
- State Identification Card 
- U.S. Passport  

If individuals requesting this access pass do not have any of the credentials listed above, they must present ALL THREE of the documents below as an alternative. 

- Original or Certified Birth Certificate (Raised Seal) 
- Social Security Card
- Driver’s License

Individuals who meet the requirements for base access this weekend WILL BE REQUIRED to formally register at the Visitor Center on Monday. PMO will be documenting everyone’s information and if individuals who gain access this weekend do not register at the Visitor Center on Monday, future base access may be restricted. 

Additionally, base patrons are HIGHLY encouraged to pre-register individuals they intend to sponsor on Camp Pendleton. This will significantly increase the flow of traffic at the Visitors Center throughout next week. 

For information on how to pre-register, visit the link below ⬇️ and look at BASE ACCESS REQUIREMENTS: UNESCORTED U.S. CITIZEN REQUEST

🌐 https://www.pendleton.marines.mil/Main-Menu/Base-Access/Sponsored-Visitors-CAC/

Please feel free to message this page with any questions. We will work on answering them in a timely manner.

MSEP employer, Republic Services has three upcoming hiring classes for REMOTE Customer Service Positions, aiming to hire 25 to 30 individuals for each class. These classes will start:
• March 17, 2025 – PST 
• March 24, 2025 – CST 
• April 28, 2025 – CST 

For more information and to apply, please visit: https://jobs.republicservices.com/us/en/

POSITION SUMMARY: With appropriate knowledge of the Company’s services and processes the Customer Resource Associate works under the direct supervision of the Customer Resource Supervisor in a Customer Resource Center to deliver the highest level of quality service to our customers. The Customer Resource Associate receives and responds to customer calls, inquiries, requests, and complaints, which may require research and investigation to reach resolution; and delivers superior customer service in a prompt, respectful and courteous manner to ensure customer concerns are resolved. 

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Successfully completes training to become knowledgeable about the waste services industry and Republic Services’ processes, services, and policies.
Responds in a timely and accurate manner to customer service calls, ensuring that service issues and concerns are treated in a respectful and professional manner.
Effectively responds to routine issues regarding residential and commercial service matters, which may involve outbound calls and other communications to resolve service inquiries and equipment issues.
Returns all internal and external calls, emails and faxes in a timely manner to ensure that customers’ concerns are understood, addressed and resolved in an efficient and complete manner.
Receives and reviews individual performance metric reports and action plans with manager to understand individual performance.
Enters service data into computer.
Logs information about customer service interactions into systems; updates information in a timely and accurate manner in order for associates to able to track service inquiries and resolution.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned or apparent.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience using bilingual skills, particularly Spanish, in a business environment.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
1-year recent customer service or call center experience

NO FEDERAL OR USMC ENDORSEMENT IMPLIED

After 37 incredible years, Kadokawa's Dragon Magazine is set to release its final issue in Spring 2025. 🌟

This legendary publication has been the literary home to some of the most beloved light novel series, including Full Metal Panic!, Spy Classroom, Slayers, Date A Live, and countless others. Its impact on the world of anime and light novels is undeniable, and its legacy will forever be cherished by fans around the globe.

Take a trip with IT&T to the Dazaifu Shrine before Lalaport Shopping Mall in Fukuoka. Dazaifu Tenman-gū  is a Shinto shrine in Dazaifu, Fukuoka Prefecture. Part Time Call Center Operator Naval Medical Center Camp Lejeune
https://jobs.johnsoncontrols.com/job/WD30230709

Job Description
****Hours for this position will be: Monday thru Friday 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM. Saturday thru Sunday: 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM. 24hrs weekly guaranteed with potential for more hours depending on availability.****

What you will do
Responsible for monitoring several naval hospital systems at Camp Lejeune, including fire alarm, security, public address/sound/radio, nurse call /code blue, infant protection and telephone answering systems in a 24/7 call center environment.

Location:Camp LeJeune, NC (military experience not required)
Shift:Monday thru Friday 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM. Saturday thru Sunday: 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM. 24hrs weekly guaranteed with potential for more hours depending on availability.

**This is a Bargaining Union position.

How you will do it
Duties include answering multiple phone lines and documenting key information, verifying pass codes, coordinating after hour's responses, troubleshooting to assist clients with re-setting, bypassing, or other issues with alarm systems, documentation of events occurring during alarm activation, and data entry in multiple databases.

What we look for
Required

Minimum of 1 year of experience with multi-line telephones preferred.
Previous alarm monitoring or customer service experience required.
Must be able to multi-task.
Must have excellent customer relations skills.
Must be proficient with computers and typing.
Must be able to work a rotating shift schedule that includes days, nights, weekends, and holidays as necessary.
Preferred

Three or more years of experience working in a call center environment.
Experience working in a monitoring call center environment

NO FEDERAL OR USMC ENDORSEMENT IMPLIED

We asked Captain Riley E. Tejcek, United States Marine Corps 🦅 🌎 ⚓  & Member of the Team USA Bobsled Team.

What does the Marine Corps’ 250th Birthday mean to you?

"Pure excellence. 250 years is a massive milestone as the Marine Corps has shown resiliency in every clime and place as we have continued to keep our country safe in every battle we have engaged in. Over the past 250 years we have seen so much growth and adaptation. I am thankful for the Marines who paved the road 250 years ago and am honored to be apart of the BEST warfighting organization as I get to see it to 250 years. "

Readiness in the Marine Corps refers to the knowledge and skills a Marine must have to be mission capable. It also includes the personal and family members’ knowledge and skills needed to be successful within the military lifestyle. Take a trip with IT&T to the Dazaifu Shrine before Lalaport Shopping Mall in Fukuoka. Dazaifu Tenman-gū  is a Shinto shrine in Dazaifu, Fukuoka Prefecture. It is built over the grave of Sugawara no Michizane (845–903) and is one of the main shrines dedicated to Tenjin, the deified form of Michizane. The Canal City Shopping Mall is one of the nice shopping malls near the Hakata (Fukuoka)train station.

RECREATION CENTER MANAGER (SINGLE MARINE PROGRAM), NF-0188-03

https://careers.usmc-mccs.org/psc/hprd/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM_FL.HRS_CG_SEARCH_FL.GBL?Page=HRS_APP_SCHJOB_FL&Action=U

This position is located with the Semper Fit Division, Single Marine Program at various Recreation Center locations.

401(k) Flex Savings Plan through Fidelity.
Tax-free shopping.
Access to MCCS facilities such as the child development centers, gyms, movie theaters, bowling centers, pools, golf course, auto skills center, outdoor recreation and more!
Professional training opportunities to build and develop new skills.
Major Duties
What to Expect

Plans, develops, and implements Marine Corps Community Services (MCCS) programs.
Develops periodic program plans and annual budget requirements with supporting data for inclusion in overall program plans formulated at higher organizational levels.
Ensures that program emphasis is on those activities most appropriate to the interests and the needs of the population served.
Projects quarterly expenditures and monitors all recreation center program operations in consonance with funds allocated.
Publicizes activities and events, educational classes/workshops for adults, fitness, and athletic activities.
Coordinates use of facilities by individuals and groups requesting a facility for private functions.
Supervises employees and any volunteers to include: assigning and distributing work, coaching, counseling, tutoring, and mentoring employees; approving and disapproving leave, recommending and completing personnel actions, disciplinary actions, completing performance reviews, signing timecards, and training employees.
This is a mixed position where the incumbent must be able to lift and carry objects up to 45lbs independently and objects over 45lbs with assistance.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications
What are we looking for?

A minimum of three years work experience in planning, organizing, and administering a recreational program.
One year supervisory experience preferred.
Bachelors degree from an accredited college/university in the field of recreation preferred.
Must be familiar with personnel management procedures and policies.
Must possess and maintain a valid driver's license.
How To Apply
STEP 1 - Qualify with Application and/or Resume.

You must meet the experience requirements described above under Qualifications. Your application and/or resume must clearly demonstrate your relevant experience to qualify. You must include employer, position title, position start date (mm/yyyy) and end date (mm/yyyy), pay grade (as applicable) for each position listed.

Internship and volunteer positions listed must also include the start date month and year (mm/yyyy) and end date month and year (mm/yyyy).
 

STEP 2 - Submit application and/or upload resume online at: https://careers.usmc-mccs.org/ 

STEP 3 - College Transcript(s), (PREFERRED)

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university (or US equivalency evaluation) is preferred for this position.  To request consideration of your degree, you must upload a copy of your unofficial college transcripts, indicating degree conferred, as an attachment to your profile under "My Job Applications" https://careers.usmc-mccs.org/. Applications received without college transcripts (if using education) will be ineligible for consideration.

STEP 4 - If prior military, upload a copy of your DD214 Member 4 or Service 2 Copy as an attachment to your profile under "My Job Applications" https://careers.usmc-mccs.org/. 

STEP 5 - Employment Preferences, May be requested for positions graded NF-3 and below, Crafts and Trades (NA, NL, & NS), and Child & Youth (CY) positions. If you are using an employment preference, please use this chart below to ensure your application includes the correct required documents to verify eligibility. 
 

PREFERENCE REQUIRED DOCUMENTS
Military Spouses 1. Furnish a copy of the PCS order identifying a dependents-authorized move and the sponsor's reporting date to the new duty location.
2. Submit a current application or resume.
3. For spouses with current or prior Federal service, submit a copy of the most recent performance appraisal rating and, if applicable, documentation of appointment eligibility.
Veterans Copy of DD214 citing general or honorable discharge.
Persons with Disabilities Proof of Disability Documentation from: doctor, licensed medical professional, licensed rehabilitation professional, or any federal, state, District of Columbia, or US territory agency that issues or provides disability benefits.
Spouses of relocating active-duty military members applying through Military Spouse Preference Program must upload all documents listed above. Spousal Preference applicants hired in a flexible position will not lose their spousal preference eligibility until declination or acceptance of a regular Full-Time or Part-Time position. Spousal Preference may only be utilized once for each permanent relocation.

As applicable, upload all required documents above to your profile under "My Job Applications" in the MCCS Careers application portal https://careers.usmc-mccs.org/. 

STEP 6 - If applicable, upload a copy of your Transition Assistance form and copy of ID card with "TA" stamped on front of card as an attachment to your profile under "My Job Applications" https://careers.usmc-mccs.org/. 

Transition Assistance Program: (May be requested for positions graded NF-3 below or equivalent) Involuntarily separated members of the armed forces and eligible family members applying through the Transition Assistance Program must upload all documents listed above in Step 6.

STEP 7 - Before you press "Submit Application", be sure all requested documents have been attached or uploaded.

It is the applicant's responsibility to verify that information entered, uploaded, or submitted is received, legible and accurate.  HR will not modify applications, resumes, or add missing attachments. To return to a previous or incomplete application, log into your MCCS user account.

Resumes/applications emailed or mailed will not be considered for this vacancy announcement.

ALL ONLINE APPLICATIONS AND REQUIRED DOCUMENTS MUST BE RECEIVED BY 11:59PM EASTERN STANDARD TIME (EST) ON THE CLOSING DATE LISTED IN THE JOB POSTING.

No Federal or USMC Endorcement Implied

🚨 Newcomers’ Orientation Welcome Aboard (NOWA) Brief - In-Person Event 🚨

📍 Location: Camp Foster Ocean Breeze, Northern Breeze Room, Bldg. 5906

👗 Attire: Proper civilian attire or uniform of the day.

📝 Mandatory Training: All SOFA status personnel and family members stationed in Japan must complete this training within 72 hours of arrival per USFJ Instruction 36-2811.

👶 For Families with Kids:
Ages 16+: Required to attend the NOWA Brief.

Youth & Teen Tour: Available for ages 10-15 with visits to Kishaba Youth Center, Base Exchange, Library, and Bowling Center. Limited to 28 participants—pre-register!

Ages 15 and under: Not required to attend.

💻 Virtual NOWA Brief: Available for spouses, DoD civilians, contractors with kids under 15, and single parents with kids under 15. This is a 4-hour video-based webinar. Completion info is sent via email.

👶 Child Care Services: Free childcare at Chimugukuru CDC (Bldg. 499) for ages 6 weeks to 5 years old. Pre-register at MCCS Resource & Referral office, Bldg. 495, Rm. 100.

🚌 Shuttle Service: Available for Westpac Inn guests. Departs at 0610 for SOFA testers, 0740 for the main event.

📞 Contacts for Special Accommodations:
Camp Foster: DSN 645-2104
Camp Courtney: DSN 622-7739
Camp Kinser: DSN 637-2815
Camp Hansen: DSN 623-4522
Camp Schwab: DSN 625-2622

👩‍✈️ POV Licensing Info: Test prior to the NOWA Brief is encouraged. Sessions are at Camp Foster (Bldg. 5831) and Camp Courtney (Bldg. 4319) Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri at 0800 and 1000.
We can't wait to welcome you aboard!✈️🗾

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mccs-newcomers-orientation-welcome-aboard-tickets-1042519532987?aff=ebdssbdestsearch

Are you preparing for retirement or transitioning out of service? The Blended Retirement System (BRS) combines traditional pension benefits with a portable, 401(k)-style plan to help secure your financial future.

Whether you're staying in or planning your next steps, it’s essential to understand your retirement options. The Marine for Life Network is here to provide the resources and support you need during this important transition.

Thursday, January 23
• ALL MCCS facilities remain CLOSED, including all indirect operations

• Operational status pending (to be announced Thursday, January 23)

Push Your Limits: The Ultimate Strength Showdown!

Get ready to test your strength and determination in our thrilling fitness competition! It's time to push yourself and see if you have what it takes to join the club! 

Event Highlights:
Bench - Squat - Deadlift
1000lb Club: Men / 500lb Club: Women
Raw Competition: No supportive/assistive suits allowed!
Supportive Gear Allowed: Knee sleeves, wrist wraps, and belts. 

Open to All Ability Levels: Patrons of every skill level are welcome! Earn a Challenge Coin and T-shirt by reaching the goal! Bonus Challenge: Want to leave your mark? Parenting class – THRIVE - GROW
Parents with children ages 5 – 10 years of age.
Weekly for five weeks beginning Tuesday, February 11, 2025 
Camp Foster 
Thrive is a psycho-educational course that provides evidence-informed, best-parenting guidelines that promote positive parenting, stress management and healthy lifestyle practices. This program is designed to build on your parenting strengths and develop new skills as your child grows and changes. Attendees will learn how to do the following:
• Praise and encourage your child in appropriate ways.
• Understand how to help your child manage their emotions.
• Set healthy routines and schedules in your home.
• Manage stress and reactions due to anger.
• Promote physical health for you and your child.

It also includes the personal and family members’ knowledge and skills needed to be successful within the military lifestyle. January is National Mentoring Month! For Marines and their families, mentorship plays a vital role in fostering resilience and readiness across various aspects of life, including social, spiritual, mental, and physical fitness.

🚨 Newcomers’ Orientation Welcome Aboard (NOWA) Brief - In-Person Event 🚨

📍 Location: Camp Foster Ocean Breeze, Northern Breeze Room, Bldg. 5906

👗 Attire: Proper civilian attire or uniform of the day.

📝 Mandatory Training: All SOFA status personnel and family members stationed in Japan must complete this training within 72 hours of arrival per USFJ Instruction 36-2811.

👶 For Families with Kids:
Ages 10+: Required to attend the NOWA Brief.
Youth & Teen Tour: Available for ages 10-18 with visits to Kishaba Youth Center, Base Exchange, Library, and Bowling Center. Limited to 28 participants—pre-register!
Ages 9 and under: Not required to attend.

💻 Virtual NOWA Brief: Available for spouses, DoD civilians, contractors with kids under 10, and single parents with kids under 10. This is a 4-hour video-based webinar. Completion info is sent via email.

👶 Child Care Services: Free childcare at Chimugukuru CDC (Bldg. 499) for ages 6 weeks to 5 years old. Pre-register at MCCS Resource & Referral office, Bldg. 495, Rm. 100.

🚌 Shuttle Service: Available for Westpac Inn guests. Departs at 0610 for SOFA testers, 0740 for the main event.

📞 Contacts for Special Accommodations:
Camp Foster: DSN 645-2104
Camp Courtney: DSN 622-7739
Camp Kinser: DSN 637-2815
Camp Hansen: DSN 623-4522
Camp Schwab: DSN 625-2622

👩‍✈️ POV Licensing Info: Test prior to the NOWA Brief is encouraged. Sessions are at Camp Foster (Bldg. 5831) and Camp Courtney (Bldg. 4319) Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri at 0800 and 1000.

We can't wait to welcome you aboard!✈️🗾

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mccs-newcomers-orientation-welcome-aboard-tickets-1042519532987?aff=ebdssbdestsearch

Good Morning Andrea,

Can you confirm your email address for us? I believe I see your registration in the system but want to ensure we have everything correctly in our system.

We asked Captain Riley E. Tejcek, United States Marine Corps 🦅 🌎 ⚓ & member of the U.S Women’s Olympic Bobsled team. 

What does the Marine Corps’ 250th Birthday mean to you?

"Pure excellence. 250 years is a massive milestone as the Marine Corps has shown resiliency in every clime and place as we have continued to keep our country safe in every battle we have engaged in. Over the past 250 years we have seen so much growth and adaptation. I am thankful for the Marines who paved the road 250 years ago and am honored to be apart of the BEST warfighting organization as I get to see it to 250 years."

Read more of her story and join the 250th Celebration 🎊 🦅 at https://www.mymcx.com/usmc-250th-anniversary

#marines #usabobsledding #marinecorpsbirthday #MCX #USMC250th #ItMattersWhereYouWork

About the Position: This position falls under Defense Health Agency, Naval Medical Center Camp Lejeune under the Directorate of Surgery, Orthopedic and Podiatry Clinic scheduling operating room cases for multiple physicians at three locations, entering referrals, scheduling appointments, providing care coordination with a multidisciplinary team, and compiling reports, patient medical records and other data to be utilized by senior management.

This is a Direct Hire Solicitation

QUALIFICATIONS
Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes: 1). Using electronic health record systems, such as Military Health System (MHS) Genesis Power Chart; Revenue Cycle; Microsoft Word and Excel; 2). Working with multidisciplinary teams in care coordination in a fast-paced work environment; and 3). Professional patient care, such as scheduling multiple appointments, handling medical records, tracking test results for patients, and entering personnel communications in the electronic health records.

Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone--no substitution of education for experience is permitted.
Thank you for messaging the MCAS Beaufort Airshow page! The Precision exotic will be there!

STORE MANAGER- SALVATION ARMY

Store Manager_NE-NSC_404-Thrift Store Department
461 Center St, Jacksonville, NC 28546, USA Req #33976
 Friday, January 3, 2025
Job Summary
Supervises and participates in the day-to-day operations of the Store and ensures compliance with established policies and procedures. Oversees the recruiting, training, disciplinary actions, performance evaluations, and supervision of all store employees. Ensures the accountability and security of cashier funds. Maintains the neatness and attractiveness of store merchandise; ensures that displays remain well-stocked. Supervises and oversees the sales floor, warehouse, and dispatch functions. Assists customer in locating items and prices and explains store policy. Assists employees in resolving routine problems and performing special assignments.

Essential Functions
This job description should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of this position. The incumbent may be requested to perform job-related responsibilities and tasks other than those stated in this job description.

Supervision and Training (70%):
Supervises the day-to-day operations of the Family Store; supervises, trains, and instructs employees in the proper methods and procedures; monitors work in progress and upon completion to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with established policies and procedures.

Provides input which is a determining factor in employees who are hired, terminated, provided compensation adjustments, promotions, bonuses, disciplinary actions, and evaluates employees under his/her authority.

Supervises and oversees the sales floor, warehouse, and dispatch functions.
Trains, coaches, and motivates store employees; provides regular feedback in verbal and written form.

Supervises cashier activities to ensure that all customers are treated in a polite and friendly manner; trains cashiers on the register in ringing up, recording, and receipting sales; assists cashiers and store clerks in resolving problems; ensures the security and accountability of the cashier funds; supervises and trains employees in preparing daily sales reports and bank deposits.

Oversees, prepares, maintains, and monitors work schedules for all store employees.
Plans, supervises and participates in the layout and display of store merchandise; ensures that stock is routinely rotated and ensures that prices encourage the desired level of stock turnover; plans, organizes, and supervises the preparation of displays for special promotions or seasons; notifies the warehouse personnel of low-stock items.

Supervises and trains employees in maintaining the store displays to include, but not limited to: arranging, rotating, and restocking displayed items to ensure the displays remain in a plentiful, neat, and an orderly manner for customer convenience and store attractiveness.

Supervises the unloading of incoming donations; ensures that items are properly sorted, stocked, and/or discarded in accordance with established policies and procedures; inspects appliances and furniture for needed repairs; supervises and trains employees in performing repair work and bailing clothes.

Be well-versed in, and ensure compliance to, Guide to Family Store & Donation Centers Operations manual and all other Salvation Army policies and procedure manuals including verbal and written warnings.

Supervises and oversees the sales floor, warehouse, and dispatch functions.

Customer Service/Meeting/Daily Paperwork (30%):

Opens and/or closes store doors in accordance with the store schedule.

Assists customers in locating items and prices; assists customers donating items; explains store policy and ensures compliance with the same.

Oversees, prepares, reviews, monitors, and maintains files and various store reports, records, forms and other similar documents including community service records; ensures the accuracy and completeness of the same.

Oversees, reviews, and monitors daily stores sales figures and reports.

Oversees and documents with Human Resources, all employee matters warranting disciplinary action, warnings, and or terminations.

Attends all production and store meetings.

Maintains a positive working atmosphere by acting and communicating in a professional manner that will establish and promote a professional working relationship with vendors, donors, customers, beneficiaries, co-workers and management.

Maintains inventory of supplies and equipment for the store and warehouse operations.
Attend manager meetings and keep store personnel informed of new policies and directives.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of the principles and practices of retail store management.

Knowledge of the principles and practices of effective customer relations.

Ability to prepare and maintain accurate and complete bookkeeping records.

Ability to evaluate overall store operations in order to detect deficiencies and implement appropriate corrective action.

Ability to price donated merchandise reasonably and fairly.

Knowledge of effective customer service techniques.

Knowledge of the principles and practices of basic mathematics.

Ability to read, write and effectively communicate in the English language.

Ability to operate a cash register.

Ability to accurately and timely perform routine mathematical computations and count change.

Ability to meet attendance requirements.

Ability to successfully work with a variety of personalities and people in a positive manner.

When an application is selected for review, typically, only applicants who indicate the relevant education and experience requirements, as indicated in the job description for the position, may be considered for job openings. Please FULLY complete the application, answer questions completely, honestly and to the best of your ability. Please also upload a copy of your resume (when available). Those applicants requiring accommodation to the application and/or interview process should contact a representative of the Human Resources Department at the applicable location.

We appreciate your interest in employment opportunities with The Salvation Army!

PARALEGAL/ LEGAL ASSISTANT 

The paralegal/legal assistant will be a highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive member of the team. A successful candidate will play a key role in supporting the attorney with case preparation, client communication, and administrative tasks. This position requires excellent communication skills, a strong work ethic, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities and Job Duties:

Case Management:
Assist with preparing, organizing, and maintaining case files
Conduct legal research and compile case law relevant to ongoing cases
Draft legal documents, including pleadings, motion, subpoenas, contracts, and agreements
Review and summarize case files and documents
Client Interaction:
Serve as a point of contact for clients, ensuring excellent client service
Schedule client meetings, maintain calendars, and manage correspondence
Provide updates to clients regarding case progress under attorney supervision
Administrative Support:
Coordinate attorney schedules, court filings, and deadlines
File documents with local courts using e-filing systems
Organize and manage discovery documents, exhibits, and trial materials
Handle administrative duties such as answering phones, data entry, and document management
Legal Research and Writing:
Research statutes, case law, and other legal precedents
Draft case summaries, correspondence, and internal memos
Prepare exhibits, evidence, and documents for depositions, hearings, and trials
Compliance and Confidentiality:
Ensure compliance with legal procedures and court requirements
Maintain strict confidentiality of client information and firm operations

https://www.ncworks.gov/vosnet/jobbanks/jobdetails.aspx?

The DEXA is a low dose x-ray machine, so try to wear clothing that’s free of metal (eg zippers, buttons, clasps). Our Human Performance staff will be able to give you specifics on the benefits, but overall this technology allows you to accurately measure your body fat percentage, muscle mass, resting metabolic rate, and bone mineral density.

These valuable insights into your overall health and fitness can help you optimize performance or improve their well-being, and our staff will help you understand the metrics so that you can implement any diet/workout/lifestyle changes going forward.

📢 URGENT REMINDER TO OUR COMMUNITY: PVSA Submission Deadline is THIS SUNDAY!

This is a friendly reminder that the Presidential Volunteer Service Award (PVSA) submission deadline is this Sunday, January 12, 2025. Please ensure all required documentation is submitted on time, as late submissions cannot be accepted.

Submission Options:
 • Email: VolunteerNow@okinawa.usmc-mccs.org
 • Drop-off Locations:
 • Camp Foster Marine Corps Family Team Building Office, Bldg. 445
 • Local Single Marine Program Office

Additionally, nominations for the Volunteer Service Award (VSA) are now open. Units may nominate up to two individuals for this prestigious recognition. The nomination deadline is January 31, 2025.

For questions or assistance, please contact:
Phone: 098-970-3749 / 645-3749
Email: VolunteerNow@okinawa.usmc-mccs.org

Thank you for your support in recognizing the outstanding volunteers in our community. Let’s celebrate their incredible contributions together!

Feast Your Eyes and Your Belly!🌼

Join us for the annual Okinawa Flower and Food Festival!!🍽️🌿✨

Date: January 18th (Saturday) 
Time: 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM

Experience the Taste of Okinawa:

🍍Savor Local Flavors: Sample the best of Okinawan cuisine, from traditional dishes to modern fusion.
🌸Admire Beautiful Blooms: Immerse yourself in a vibrant display of colorful flowers and plants.
🛍️Shop 'Til You Drop: Browse unique local products and souvenirs.

Tour Prices:
Adult: $15
Child (4-12): $10
3 and under: Free

For more information and sign up: 
📞098-971-3502
🌐

Dive into Wonder at Churaumi Aquarium 🐋💙

Immerse yourself in the breathtaking underwater world of the Churaumi Aquarium. Marvel at majestic whale sharks and graceful manta rays gliding through massive tanks, among countless other marine wonders.

🗓️Date : Sunday, January 19, 2025
Time :  09:00 am - 05:00 pm

Beyond the Aquarium:

Early Spring Experience 🌷:
Don't miss the annual Tulip Fair in January 2025! A beloved event, it showcases a vibrant display of colorful tulips against the backdrop of the beautiful Okinawan landscape.

Dolphin Show 🐬: Be amazed by the intelligence and agility of these magnificent creatures in a captivating performance.

Okinawan Village🌿: Experience the rich culture and history of Okinawa through traditional crafts, demonstrations, and cultural performances.
Emerald Beach ⛱️: Relax on the pristine shores of Emerald Beach, enjoying the crystal-clear waters and stunning scenery.

For more information and sign up: 
📞098-971-3502
🌐

📍 **Camp Courtney**: 622-7332  
📍 **Camp Hansen**: 623-4522

Explore the Hidden Tunnels and Bunkers of the Battle of Okinawa 🪖 🔦

Join us on a unique and unforgettable journey through time as we uncover the secrets of Okinawa's WWII past. 

You would never have guessed that these caves and tunnels existed based on the location. 
Our tour guide, with over 20 years of experience, will lead you through this hidden world, sharing fascinating stories and insights. 🥾✨

Date: Saturday,  February 8th 
Time: 9:00 - 17:00
Adult: $45, Child (8-11): $38.

☝️Important Notes: 
Participants must be at least 8 years old to join the tour.

Bring dollars for lunch. Wear sturdy shoes, old clothes, and a hat.
Bring a flashlight and gloves. 🔦🧤

For more information and sign up: 
📞098-971-3502
🌐
🎒 Register for before/after school care: https://public.militarychildcare.csd.disa.mil/mcc-central/mcchome#/

You will serve as a TRAINING SPECIALIST in the ACADEMICS BRANCH, MARINE CORPS ENGINEER SCHOOL of TRAINING AND EDUCATION COMMAND.

Your resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-09 grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: Providing quality control and uniformity in the implementation of courseware development and documentation; analyzing, studying, and evaluating training and instruction for higher level approval; AND identifying problems and recommending solutions.

You will be rated based on the information provided in your resume and responses to the Occupational Questionnaire, along with your supporting documentation to determine your ability to demonstrate the following competencies:

Attention to Detail
COMPUTER LITERACY
CREATIVITY AND INNOVATION
Customer Service
Decision Making
Flexibility
INFORMATION MANAGEMENT
Integrity/Honesty
Interpersonal Skills
PROBLEM SOLVING
Reading Comprehension
Self-Management
Stress Tolerance
Teamwork
TRAINING PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION
WRITTEN COMMUNICATION
Your info has been forwarded to our programmers. They will reach out if any of them are interested. Thanks for reaching out. Good luck with your venture and thank you for your service.

The world has lost a true visionary. David Lynch, the legendary director behind some of the most groundbreaking and surreal films of our time, has passed away. From Eraserhead to Mulholland Drive, Lynch’s unique cinematic style changed the landscape of storytelling. He also brought Frank Herbert’s Dune to the big screen in 1984, crafting a version that, though polarizing, remains iconic in its boldness and ambition. His influence will continue to echo through film for generations.

🚨 UPDATED WEATHER ALERT - January 21-23, 2025

Due to forecasted snow accumulation of 4-6" in Onslow and surrounding counties beginning today and extending into Wednesday, January 22, MCCS Lejeune-New River has issued the following guidance:

Tuesday, January 21 (TODAY)
• MCCS services and activities at MCB Camp Lejeune and MCAS New River will close at 1:00 PM
• Child Development Centers will remain open until 3:00 PM to allow parents time for pickup
• Camp Lejeune MCX, MCAS New River MCX, and all Marine Marts will close at 3:00 PM
• Immediate evacuation required for Onslow Beach Recreational Lodging areas (houses/RV park)

Wednesday, January 22
• ALL MCCS facilities will be CLOSED, including all indirect operations (such as Wendy's, Dunkin', Firestone, and other contracted services)

Thursday, January 23
• MCCS will operate on a four-hour delay
• Facilities will open no earlier than 11:00 AM
• Regular start times apply if normally scheduled after 11:00 AM

MCCS Employees: Please contact your supervisors for reporting instructions.

⚠️ Please note this guidance may be adjusted as weather conditions develop. Continue monitoring our social media channels and website for updates on weather conditions and any changes to facility operations.

Additional Base Facility Updates Please monitor the following websites for information on impacts to their facilities and services:
• MCCS Lejeune-New River: https://lejeunenewriver.usmc-mccs.org/
• MCB Camp Lejeune: https://www.lejeune.marines.mil/
• MCAS New River: https://www.newriver.marines.mil/
• Naval Medical Center Camp Lejeune: https://camp-lejeune.tricare.mil/
